paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information specifically for the BRCA2 gene, including penetrance data.

functional_data.summary: This is a single nucleotide variant which causes a non-synonymous transversion from adenine to thymine in exon 25 of the BRCA2 gene, resulting in a missense mutation.

variants.population_frequency: Reported in German, Polish, and Slovenian populations; most common pathogenic variant in Romanian population.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multiple reports.
variants.additional_notes: Identified in 4 patients from North-Western Romania and 5 from Central Romania.
key_quotes: BRCA2 c.9371A>T is the most common pathogenic variant identified in our study, accounting for almost half of the cases.

functional_data.summary: This variant is also a single nucleotide variant described in Czech, Austrian, and Italian populations.

variants.population_frequency: Previously reported in the Romanian population.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on previous studies.
variants.additional_notes: Identified in a mother and daughter of Hungarian descent diagnosed with breast cancer.
key_quotes: BRCA2 c.8755-1G>A was identified in three cases.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data for BRCA2 variants were extracted successfully.
